marketNews.title: China Potentially Cuts Low-Grade Coal Imports
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that China is likely to cut imports of low-grade coal, which could be negative sentiment for its exporters like Indonesia. Bloomberg reported that this likelihood is based on coal supply glut in China and the Chinese government's efforts to tighten carbon emissions. China Huadian Corp. - one of the largest power plants in China - estimates total Chinese coal imports will only be around 400 million tons in 2025, significantly down from the record import of 543 million tons in 2024. China Huadian Corp.'s projection is even lower than the estimate from the China Coal Transportation and Distribution Association earlier this year which predicted that Chinese coal imports during 2025 would range around 525 million tons. Li Xuegang, an analyst from the China Coal Transportation and Distribution Association, stated that China's thermal coal imports have declined year-on-year for 3 consecutive months as of May 2025. Li predicts that this downward trend will accelerate further for the rest of this year. Previously, commodity analysis firm Kpler noted last week that thermal coal import volumes in Asia reached 74.12 million tons in May 2025, growing +8.1% MoM although still down -5.3% YoY. This result marks the highest monthly thermal coal import volume in the last 5 months, amidst falling coal prices from Indonesia and Australia to a four-year low due to increased domestic supply from China and India. Cumulatively during 5M25, thermal coal import volume in Asia fell -7% YoY to 346.96 million tons, according to Kpler data.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Things You Need to Know...
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that the consumer confidence index (IKK) in Indonesia fell to 117.5 in May 2025 (vs. April 2025: 121.7), marking the lowest consumer confidence level since September 2022. The US statistics bureau recorded that the consumer price index (CPI) inflation in the US reached 2.4% YoY in May 2025 (vs. April 2025: 2.3% YoY inflation), lower than the consensus expectation of 2.5% YoY although marking the first annual inflation increase in the last 4 months. On a monthly basis, US inflation reached 0.1% MoM (vs. April 2025: 0.2% MoM inflation), below the consensus expectation of 0.2% MoM. Core inflation in May 2025 remained steady at 2.8% YoY, unchanged for the last 3 months. CEO of BPI Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, stated that his company is considering potential investments in government waste management projects, including waste-to-energy conversion projects. Rosan also mentioned that Danantara will collaborate with private parties in waste-to-energy projects, although he did not elaborate further. The Minister of Environment, Hanif Faisol, stated that waste-to-energy projects have been included in the 2029 National Medium-Term Development Plan (RPJMN) targets. Bloomberg reported that President Prabowo Subianto will visit Russian President Vladimir Putin in Russia on June 18-20, 2025, thus missing the direct meeting with Western leaders at the G-7 Summit in Canada. Bloomberg reported that this raises questions about the direction of Indonesia's diplomatic strategy, although the Ministry of Foreign Affairs spokesperson affirmed that Indonesia still adheres to the free and active foreign policy doctrine. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs also explained that the travel plan to Russia was designed long before the invitation from the G-7 Summit emerged. The Solvent Extractors' Association of India recorded that India's CPO imports rose +84% MoM in May 2025 to 592,888 tons, marking the highest monthly import volume since November 2024. Despite this, the volume is still lower compared to the historical average of Indian CPO imports which reached over 750,000 tons per month during the marketing year ending in October 2024. Agricultural industry research firm, GGN Research, estimates that Indian CPO imports will increase further in June 2025 with volumes potentially rising to the range of 850,000 tons, driven by cheaper CPO prices compared to soybean oil. Reuters reported that CPO traders expect India's vegetable oil imports to increase in the coming months, supported by the policy of reducing import tariffs on vegetable oil commodities in India this month.

marketNews.title: From Reports to the Field: Unveiling Business Realities Behind the Numbers
marketNews.content: "From Reports to the Field: Unveiling Business Realities Behind the Numbers." - Fadhilonn

tickerNews.title: PTBA Shareholders Approve Dividend Indicating 11.1% Yield
tickerNews.content: PTBA: Bukit Asam shareholders approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 3.8 trillion rupiah or 332 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 75% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 75%) and indicates a dividend yield of 11.1% as of Thursday (12/6). The cum-date and payment date are not yet known.

tickerNews.title: TPIA: Siam Cement considers selling 10.57% stake in Chandra Asri Pacific
tickerNews.content: TPIA: Siam Cement Public Company Limited (BKK: SCC) announced in an information disclosure on the Thai stock exchange that it is considering selling a 10.57% stake in Chandra Asri Pacific. Siam Cement explained that this divestment plan aligns with the company's strategy to reduce debt and reallocate capital to future business opportunities. Siam Cement currently holds a 30.57% stake in TPIA through its subsidiary, SCG Chemicals Public Company Limited. Siam Cement stated that the divestment value cannot yet be calculated, as the plan is still in the consideration stage.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Shareholders Approve Dividend Distribution of Rp3.6T, 100% Payout Ratio
tickerNews.content: ANTM: Aneka Tambang shareholders approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 3.6 trillion rupiah or 151.77 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 100% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 100%) and indicates a dividend yield of 4.8% as of Thursday (12/6). The cum-date and payment date are not yet known.

tickerNews.title: ASII Wholesale Car Sales Down 17% YoY in May 2025, Market Share Drops to 56.9%
tickerNews.content: ASII: Astra International recorded car wholesales of 34,480 units in May 2025 (-17% YoY, +28% MoM), a deeper annual decline compared to the industry (-15% YoY, +18% MoM), resulting in ASII's market share falling to 56.9% (vs. May 2024: 57.9%, April 2025: 52.7%). The decline in ASII's wholesales in May 2025 was pressured by a drop in Daihatsu sales to 11,166 units (-25% YoY, +26% MoM), while Toyota + Lexus sales recorded 21,241 units (-11% YoY, +31% MoM). Cumulatively, ASII's car wholesale sales during 5M25 fell to 172,268 units (-8% YoY), with market share dropping to 54.3% (vs. 5M24: 56%).

tickerNews.title: ADHI Booked New Contracts of Rp2.6 Trillion as of May 2025
tickerNews.content: ADHI: The Corporate Secretary of Adhi Karya, Rozi Sparta, stated that the company recorded new contract value of 2.6 trillion rupiah during 5M25 (-72% YoY), equivalent to 9.3-10.4% of the 2025 target set at 25-28 trillion rupiah. Rozi explained that this significant decrease was caused by the government's budget adjustment for infrastructure. Based on the source, ADHI's new contracts during 2025 originated from State-Owned Enterprises/Regional-Owned Enterprises (56%), State Budgets (23%), private sector (20%), and loans (1%).

tickerNews.title: HRTA Shareholders Approve Dividend of 21 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi shareholders approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 21 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to approximately 22% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 23%) and indicates a dividend yield of 3.3% as of Thursday (12/6). The cum-date and payment date are not yet known.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Shareholders Approve Dividend Distribution of ~Rp148.6 Billion from 2024 Earnings
tickerNews.content: SMRA: Summarecon Agung shareholders approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 148.6 billion rupiah or 9 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to an 11% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: approximately 19%) and indicates a dividend yield of 2.1% as of Thursday (12/6). The cum-date and payment date have not yet been announced.

tickerNews.title: NICL to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2025 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: PAM Mineral (NICL) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to approximately 159.5 billion rupiah or 15 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 1.2% as of Thursday (12/6). The cum-date in the regular and negotiated market is June 20, 2025, while payment is scheduled for June 30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: FASW Plans Rights Issue to Raise Up to ~Rp3.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Fajar Surya Wisesa (FASW) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to approximately 743.4 million new shares with an exercise price of 4,700 rupiah per share, a 10:3 ratio, and potential dilution effect of up to 23.08%. The potential funds raised from this corporate action amount to approximately 3.5 trillion rupiah, which will be used for partial loan repayment and working capital. The cum-date in the regular and negotiated market is June 19, 2025, while the trading and execution period for the rights issue runs from June 25 to July 2, 2025.
